title.narrative: Towards creating sustainable market linkages and initiating value addition on fruits and vegetables

description.narrative:
BHAG: To establish the first farmer owned juice factory in Ethiopia Gamo Gofa Farmers Vegetable & Fruit Marketing Cooperative Union PLC (GGCU). The union is located in the city center of Arba Minch town, Gamu Gofa Zone, SNNP-Region. The union has a lot of fruit and vegetable production potential especially banana, mango, Apple etc. in the union working area more than four hundred thousand tons per year produced. The has been Agriterra client since January 2017. The union has been engaged in the marketing activities of banana, apple and manage fruits. Although the union have an enormous production potential, the union only collect and sells 5-7% of their members' produces. In the fruit and vegetable value chain brokers have strong influence and dominate the market. Hence, for the past years most of the farmers at Gamo Gofa union have been highly exploited by brokers and local traders and they are selling their fruits with low price. The farmers are always the price taker's not a decider. In the bigger cities like Addis Ababa, the price for fruits and vegetables are becoming too high. This is mainly emanated because of a very length value chain and presence of too many actors/brokers in this chain.
In 2017 action plan, Agriterra has able to create awareness for the Gamo Gofa union board member and management about the importance of bringing a breakthrough change in their making outlets and marketing system, capacitated the union management and board about financial management and improved the union relationship with its primary cooperatives. In addition, two direct market linkage (with Nigat consumer cooperatives and Fresh Corner supermarket) both found in Addis Ababa. These linkages are innovative and have dual benefits: The transaction costs will be less by avoiding too many actors in the value chain which leads a lesser price for consumers and for Gamo Gofa it has created a reliable and sustainable market. But still more effort should be exerted to assist the Union further to be very competent in the fruit and vegetable value chain. In 2018 year, we will further create a sustainable market, improve the union equity capital, professionalize the union financial management by installing sage 50 software, install internal control mechanism and initiate value addition on fruits.
Strengthening the union management and board competencesConducting feasibility study on fruit value additionCreating 3 sustainable market linkagesMobilizing 1.02 million ETB equity capital from membersProfessionalize the union financial management by installing sage 50 software
